intro: Melittis melissophyllum f. albida, commonly known as the white-flowered form of the sweet cicely, is a variant of the sweet cicely plant characterized by its pale or white flowers. This subspecies belongs to the Apiaceae family and is native to southern Europe and parts of the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. The plant features finely divided, aromatic leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to gardens and ecological landscapes.
